meanings.definition: To install new wiring in (a building, machine, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The electrician is rewiring the old house to make it safer.
meanings.sent2: They decided to start rewiring the office building to update the electrical system.
meanings.sent3: After rewiring the kitchen, the chef realized the oven now talks to the fridge!
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was rewiring her brain when learning a new language.
meanings.sent5: The process of rewiring the entire house was tedious but necessary.

meanings.definition: To make changes to (something) in order to improve it
meanings.sent1: The company is rewiring its marketing strategy to reach more customers.
meanings.sent2: He is rewiring his approach to studying to achieve better grades.
meanings.sent3: Rewiring the garden layout led to a surprising increase in vegetable yield.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was rewiring her mindset to be more positive.
meanings.sent5: The team's decision to start rewiring their project plan resulted in greater efficiency.
